breadcrumbs: Step 4: If Damage Remains, Reduce the Target's Hit Points
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Nonlethal Attacks](/Rules.aspx?ID=348)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 453 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
You can make a nonlethal attack in an effort to knock someone out instead of killing them (see [Knocked Out and Dying](/Rules.aspx?ID=373)). Weapons with the [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) trait (including fists) do this automatically. You take a –2 circumstance penalty to the attack roll when you make a nonlethal attack using a weapon that doesn't have the nonlethal trait. You also take this penalty when making a lethal attack using a nonlethal weapon.

 Spells and other effects with the nonlethal trait that reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points knock the creature out instead of killing them.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
